Row.Text: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Trading Posts and Customs Houses. [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to this City generate +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nearby [ICON_RES_SPICES] Spices: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE]Nearby [ICON_RES_SUGAR] Sugar: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold on Trading Posts, Towns, Villages, and Customs Houses.

The Kobstad is the unique Kalmar Union Market. It increases the amount of [ICON_GOLD] Gold a city generates, especially when working a Trading Posts, Towns, Villages, or Customs Houses. Trade routes other players make to a city with a Kobstad will generate an extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city owner and the trade route owner gains an additional 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route.

It would be a great boon to not only our wealth, but also to our friendships, to extend those rights accorded to Danish merchants to those that flock to our towns with foreign goods to trade. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be the Kalmar Union. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have at least one allied City-State. [ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Medieval Era. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gifts of [ICON_GOLD] Gold yield 20% more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with City-States.

The noble lords of our privy council have little to do all day than to question our authority. So, let us send them on a diplomatic mission and perhaps they will finally be of some use to the realm. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be the Kalmar Union. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Medieval Era. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per era. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 {2_Resource} [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive a free Magnate, a unit that can be sent to a City-State to generate [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence. It ignores borders. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Note: The [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost increases with era.[ENDCOLOR]

The noble lords of our privy council have little to do all day than to question our authority. So, let us send them on a diplomatic mission and perhaps they will finally be of some use to the realm. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive a free Magnate, a unit that can be sent to a City-State to generate [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence. It ignores borders.

The Magnate is a unique unit only available via the 'Dispatch a Magnate' decision, unique to the Kalmar Union. It can be sent to a City-State to conduct a Diplomatic Mission in order to generate [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence.

A Magnate, from the Latin magnas, meaning a great man, designates a noble or other man in a high social position, by birth, wealth or other qualities. In reference to the Middle Ages, the term is often used to distinguish higher territorial landowners and warlords such as counts, earls, dukes, and territorial-princes from the baronage.
+100% [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence and -100% [ICON_GOLD] Gold from a Diplomatic Mission with a City-State.
